issue.title: Provide OSGi metadata
issue.body:
Vert.x core does provide OSGi metadata in the `MANIFEST.MF` file. It would be good if vertx-proton would also provide OSGi metadata so that consumers of `vertx-proton` can use OSGi.

I would be willing to create a PR for this.

Also see:
 * https://github.com/eclipse/vert.x/blob/master/pom.xml#L610
 * eclipse/hono#475

body:
vert.x has merged this.

So the only problematic components seems to be spring. Either we make this optional. Or we could manually align the OSGi metadata with spring 4.x as the Apache ServiceMix project does offer OSGi-fied spring versions.
Fixing #478 would also make it way easier this this issue.

I agree. See my latest comment in #478.
Do you want to give it a shot?
Working on #478? Yes, I was hoping for that :wink:

So the only missing piece is vertx-proton 3.6.0 now.

I would propose to merge in the OSGi metadata generation anyway. Leaving this issue open until we switched to vertx-proton 3.6.0+ and live with the fact that we ship ugly OSGi metadata until then.

> and live with the fact that we ship ugly OSGi metadata until then.

Why would the OSGi metadata be ugly?

Because it would create an import of "io.vertx.proton" with no version, which currently no bundle could provide. Unless you are using Karaf with the "wrap" option.

However, once we update the dependency of vertx-proton, that issue would be gone with no further change on the maven OSGi settings on our side.

> Because it would create an import of "io.vertx.proton" with no version, which currently no bundle could provide. Unless you are using Karaf with the "wrap" option.

The *bad thing* being that nobody can currently provide the package, right?

> The bad thing being that nobody can currently provide the package, right?

Correct. But as I mentioned, Karaf can handle this using the "wrap" deployer [1], so depending in the specific OSGi container/distribution, this may or may not be a problem.

[1] https://karaf.apache.org/manual/latest/#_wrap_deployer
It kind of is. We could leave this issue open though until we use vertx 3.6. Referencing this to some vertx 3.6 tracking issue which we need for the MQTT client cert issue as well.
Will we change anything in the affected components (core, client) once vert.x 3.6 is released and includes OSGi manifest headers?
@ctron Then why would we want to keep this issue open?
